title: Tesla Stock Is Stuck. It Needs This to Get Moving Again.
text: The EV maker's shares have formed a new trading range. Something dramatic will need to happen to snap them out of it.

title: Tesla May Have an Ace Up Its Sleeve to Propel Shares Higher
text: There's no denying Tesla (TSLA 2.87%) is accomplishing extraordinary things and will likely continue doing so for years to come. The Elon Musk-led company is building fully electric cars for the masses, growing a massive energy storage business, and developing bleeding-edge technology, all while amassing a war chest of cash that will likely help further fortify its competitive position.

title: Tesla's Q4 earnings miss: Investors left 'less than nourished'
text: EV maker Tesla (TSLA) fell short of fourth quarter estimates for revenue and adjusted earnings per share (EPS), posting revenue of $25.71 billion (below expectations for $27.21 billion) and earnings of $0.73 (below expectations for $0.75). The company's automotive revenue fell 8% year-over-year, mainly due to price cuts across its vehicle lineup.

title: Tesla to Launch Self-Driving Car Service in Texas in June, Elon Musk Says
text: The company plans to use its Model Y and Model 3 cars until its Cybercab launches in 2027.

title: Tesla, Meta, and Microsoft: Tips to play the AI trade
text: Tesla (TSLA), Microsoft (MSFT), and Meta Platforms (META) reported earnings after Wednesday's closing bell, as investors weigh which Big Tech giant is best positioned for artificial intelligence (AI) gains. Procyon senior private wealth advisor Jerry Sneed sits down with Brad Smith to outline his thoughts on Tesla, Microsoft, and Meta's AI prospects.

title: Tesla free cash flow beat counters soft 2025 guidance, analysts believe
text: Tesla free cash flow beat counters soft 2025 guidance, analysts believe Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:TSLA) shares moved higher as delivered a free cash flow beat and reaffirmed key upcoming milestones despite its fourth quarter sales and profits falling short of expectations. Shares of Tesla added 4.4% at $406 on Thursday afternoon.

title: Why Tesla Stock Was Climbing Today
text: Shares of Tesla (TSLA 4.28%) were moving higher today, overcoming a weak earnings report after CEO Elon Musk spent much of the earnings call pumping up the stock and making big promises about autonomy.

title: A Toe, A Foot, And Then A Leg: Maintaining Tesla With A Buy
text: Tesla, Inc. reported Q4 2024 results on Wednesday after the bell, and the company missed on top and bottom lines. I can't say I was surprised when TSLA stock jumped over 6% in pre-market trading on Thursday and another 5.6% after the market opened on the Musk Magic. I think the company is doing well in targeting its AI investments and raising investor confidence in its future trajectory, but I remain wary of the tariff impact on profitability.

title: Johnson: TSLA "Priced for Fantastic Growth," Has Yet to Deliver
text: Whether it's EV sales, free cash flow or cybertruck's past safety issues, Corry Johnson says there's a lot of roadblocks in Tesla's (TSLA) outlook. "It's become very personal for me" when Tesla makes promises it doesn't deliver, according to Cory, which he fears can continue in 2025.

title: Barclays' Dan Levy: Tesla's stock is disconnected from fundamentals
text: Dan Levy, Barclays senior equity research analyst, joins CNBC's 'The Exchange' to discuss outlooks on Tesla's earnings.

title: Tesla's robotaxi ambitions taking shape
text: CNBC's Deirdre Bosa joins 'The Exchange' to discuss Tesla's robotaxi plans.

title: FSD, Robotics, And AI: Looking Past Tesla's Earnings Numbers
text: Tesla, Inc.'s Q4 2024 results missed expectations, but future growth prospects in FSD, AI, and robotics make it one of my top long ideas for 2025. Despite lower automotive margins, Tesla's energy and services segments showed strong growth, with the new Model Y expected to boost ASPs and margins. Exciting developments include FSD rollouts, robotaxi services, and the Optimus robot, potentially driving significant revenue and profitability growth in the coming years.

title: Elon Musk says a paid robotaxi service launches in June — and Tesla will dip a 'toe in the water' before expanding it
text: Elon Musk announced plans for Tesla to launch a paid robotaxi service in Austin this summer. Musk said expanding the service to allow Tesla owners to rent out their own vehicles is expected next year.

title: Four Key Takeaways From Tesla's Latest Earnings and Elon Musk's Conference Call
text: Tesla's earnings report and conference call Wednesday shed light on the electric vehicle maker's plans for new versions of its self-driving software and its humanoid robot, Optimus.

title: Tesla Misses on Q4 Earnings, Vows to Return to Growth: ETFs to Buy
text: Tesla misses fourth-quarter earnings and revenue estimates but pledges a return to growth in 2025. Investors should tap the opportune moment with these ETFs.

title: TSLA's "Challenging" 2025, "Has to Execute" Autonomous Strategy
text: Steve Westly says Tesla (TSLA) has "a lot of catching up to do" on the autonomous front, saying companies like BYD Co. (BYDDY) and Waymo are already far ahead. Hatem Dhiab agrees, noting that Elon Musk will need to execute his vision for the company's future fast to stay in the race.

title: Is Tesla Stock 'Bulletproof' Now? Here's Why Some Investors Think So
text: Tech companies sell the future, and few do so more determinedly than Tesla.

title: Tesla Analysts Highlight FSD, Robotaxis, New Vehicles For Growth: 'Elon Has Never Sounded So Bullish'
text: Tesla Inc TSLA analysts highlighted a confirmation of the low-cost vehicle in 2025, unsupervised FSD and updates on Optimus Bot as the key takeaways from the company's fourth-quarter financial results.

title: S&P 500: Tech Stocks Struggle as Microsoft Drops, Meta and Tesla Shine
text: Meta and Tesla rise as Microsoft slumps, keeping US indices mixed. Investors await Apple and Amazon earnings while GDP and Fed policy weigh on sentiment.

title: Cheap EV Key to Tesla Rally
text: Several things negated the Tesla Inc. (NASDAQ: TSLA) stock price drop that might have happened because of the electric vehicle (EV) maker's mediocre earnings report.

title: Tesla Q4: Cortex Supports Its Autonomous Driving Technology
text: I reiterate a Strong Buy rating for Tesla, Inc. stock with a one-year target price of $460 per share, driven by its future growth prospects. Despite a decline in the automotive business, Tesla's energy storage, FSD V13, and robotics are key growth drivers. Tesla's energy storage business grew by 67.1% in FY24 and is expected to grow by 50% annually due to massive market demands.

title: TSLA "More Volatile" Results in 2025, Cost Pressures Remain
text: Nishit Midlani says profit margins in the global auto sector are under pressure, and Tesla (TSLA) is no exception. He believes costs to build vehicles will continue to face pressure even if its assembly line shows more efficiency.

title: Dow Jumps Over 100 Points; Tesla Earnings Miss Views
text: U.S. stocks traded higher this morning, with the Dow Jones gaining more than 100 points on Thursday.

title: TSLA, MSFT and META Forecast – Major Technology Stocks React to Earnings
text: Through the biggest major technology stocks in New York: Tesla, Microsoft, and Meta are reacting to earnings calls overnight, which came in after the bell on Wednesday.

title: Tesla Misses Revenue, EPS Expectations in Q4
text: Electric vehicle manufacturer Tesla (TSLA -2.26%) reported fourth-quarter and full-year 2024 earnings on Wednesday, Jan. 29, that missed analysts consensus expectations. Tesla reported adjusted earnings per share (EPS) of $0.73 which missed forecasts for $0.77.

title: Bitcoin boost: how Tesla's crypto holdings gained $896M in value
text: Tesla Inc (NASDAQ: TSLA) attributed a significant increase in its quarterly net earnings last night to its bitcoin holdings. The company recorded $1.08 billion as the carrying value of its bitcoin holdings in its fourth-quarter release – up sharply from $184 million at the end of Q3.

title: Tesla Is Officially A Shrinking Company
text: Tesla Is Officially A Shrinking Company

title: Tesla Stock: Musk Hypes Vaporware While Results Stagnate
text: Tesla, Inc. reported fourth-quarter earnings after the close Wednesday. Revenue continues to stagnate as margins decline due to weakness in the automotive division. Fundamentals are only so relevant when it comes to TSLA stock, but long-term investors should stay away.

title: Tesla (TSLA) Trades Lower After Posting 3Q Deliveries
text: The E.V. giant said it delivered close to 463,000 vehicles between July and September and produced nearly 470,000. Investors weren't too impressed by Tesla's (TSLA) numbers.

title: Analysts revise Tesla stock price target
text: Tesla's (NASDAQ: TSLA) high valuation has long been a concern for investors. A strong surge in the price of Tesla stock in Q4 2024, as well as co-founder Elon Musk's growing alliance with President Donald Trump, led many to assume that the electric vehicle (EV) maker could maintain its upward trajectory in the first half of 2025.

title: Tesla is acting like an AI stock. Should investors focus more on auto trends?
text: One analyst warns of the potential for even more pressure on automotive gross margins. But another says moonshot ventures finally look poised to take off.

title: Kulina: Tesla is a diversified play on AI and robotics
text: Joel Kulina, Head of Technology/Media Trading at Wedbush Securities, discusses Tesla's recent earnings miss on revenue, EPS, and margins, highlighting that the stock's movement is driven by hype around AI and robotics, particularly full self-driving technology.

title: Investors continue to be very forgiving of Tesla's near-term challenges: CFRA's Garrett Nelson
text: Garrett Nelson, CFRA Research senior analyst, joins 'Squawk Box' to discuss Tesla's quarterly earnings results, the company's autonomous ambitions,

title: Tesla Misses Q4 Earnings Estimates, Upbeat on Energy Storage Business
text: TSLA expects energy storage deployments to grow at least 50% this year.

title: Tesla expects capital expenditure to exceed $11 bln in 2026, 2027
text: Tesla expects capital expenditure to exceed $11 billion this year and in each of the following two fiscal years, the electric automaker said in a filing on Thursday.
